messages.message: I’m finding that I’m unable to download large directory structures to move to another ib instance

yeah it’s a known issue. :disappointed: The issue I believe is more than just the time needed to download the large directory structure. Most of time is spent trying to zip up the large directory structure and usually it doesn’t complete which is the reason it’s corrupted when you try to open it.
ok, thanks Heymian
Been an issue for years now, and we haven’t had time or resources to figure out a way to redesign/re-write this path.
is the work around to just chop it up into smaller chunks or is there something else?
Yup, that’s the workaround. you can go into subfolders and download in chunks manually.
Where are you trying to move to and from?
dogfood to demo-2
I’m already most of the way down the path of chopping it up and reloading
just wondering if there was an easier way like ftp or something I am missing
can you link me to your source and destination?
https://demo-2.aws.sandbox.instabase.com/Demos/generic-demos/fs/Instabase%20Drive/solutions/revocable%20trusts/
that’s the target, I’m guessing I have to create a user for you
source: https://dogfood.instabase.com/SE_Team/TDDs/fs/Instabase%20Drive/solutions/revocable%20trusts/
looks like I’m not an admin on demo-2. @Bren can probably add you
let me do that now
done, @Heymian you have a user on demo-2, your password is Un1ver$e123
@Will you are now a site admin on demo-2
awesome, thanks!

Heymian, I will create tickets in the morning but this is part1 of a three-part issue. When I fix the corrupt zip and upload it to unzip - it says it is successfully unzipped but it doesn’t create anything. Part 3 is once this is successful by breaking things apart, I then have to go in and change all the paths so everything works correctly.
Should I create three tickets or one?
sry, will take a look shortly to see if there’s a way to avoid downloading. how do you fix a corrupted zip?
and what does upload it to unzip mean? are you doing this locally on your laptop?
download to my laptop
run “zip -FF input.zip --out output.zip” to fix the corrupted zip
upload to a folder on another instance of ib - right-click and go to unzip
@Bren can you make me a site admin?
or @Will can do it now too actually
done
I’m going offline now but let me know if you need anything and I can get to it in the morning

The dogfood drive has been mounted here: https://demo-2.aws.sandbox.instabase.com/Demos/generic-demos/fs/Dogfood%20Drive/ Instead of downloading, you can copy files directly from here to Instabase Drive. I’d still recommend doing smaller subfolder copies (instead of the entire folder) because copy operations will timeout at 5min (another bug we will aim to fix in Q4).
